concept.title: Directory Imformation Privacy Settings
concept.shortdesc: Under the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA), students have the right to control the visibility of their directory information maintained by NC State University.

conbody.p: The Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA) grants students the right to restrict the disclosure of certain personal information classified as directory information. This includes, but is not limited to, the student’s preferred email address, enrollment status (full-time or part-time), and major field of study.

Students may choose to restrict all or specific portions of their directory information at any time through the university’s student information system, MyPack Portal. Adjusting these settings helps students manage how their information is shared with internal and external parties.
conbody.note: Limiting the release of directory information may affect how the university communicates with third parties, including prospective employers, honor societies, and media outlets. Students should review their privacy preferences carefully before applying restrictions.
